author: Staff Reporter
text:
Building a positive image for the police among the general public by taking steps to prevent crimes and maintaining the law and order is the priority, says C. Sridhar, who assumed office as the Inspector General of Police (IG) for West Zone on Wednesday.

The cause for road accidents, which is increasing in the zone, will be studied and efforts will be taken to bring them down.

He would soon convene a meeting of SPs of the eight districts in the zone.

Earlier on Wednesday, he held preliminary discussions with Coimbatore City Police Commissioner A. Amalraj, and the SP of Coimbatore district R.V. Ramya Bharathi.

Mr. Sridhar replaces K. Shankar who has been posted as the Additional Commissioner of Police (South) of Chennai City Police. Mr. Sridhar is a 1997 batch IPS officer and has served as Superintendent of Police in Tiruchi and Tirunelveli, Deputy Commissioner of Police in Chennai City and SP of Crime Branch CID (CBCID).

On his elevation as the Deputy Inspector General of Police, he served as DIG of CBCID, Joint Commissioner, and later as Additional Commissioner of the Chennai City Police.
title: Building a positive image is priority: IG
